Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should adopt atheism", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the contextof this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Fewer wars will arise since there will be no fighting over holy lands or differing religions.<sep>Keypoint: Atheism should be adopted since we cannot prove that god exists
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that fewer wars will arise since there will be no fighting over holy lands or differing religions.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: If we adopt atheism then maybe people will start believing in the scientific community again.<sep>Keypoint: Atheism should be adopted since we cannot prove that god exists
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that if we adopt atheism then maybe people will start believing in the scientific community again.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Millions of people have died in the name of religion, atheism is a peaceful alternative.<sep>Keypoint: Science can adequately explain the universe
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that millions of people have died in the name of religion, atheism is a peaceful alternative.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Religion has been the cause of countless wars so adopting atheism would put a stop to religion based conflict.<sep>Keypoint: Religions are immoral and people should not follow them
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that religion has been the cause of countless wars so adopting atheism would put a stop to religion based conflict.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Atheism would be against our right to religious freedom.<sep>Keypoint: Atheism lacks morality
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that atheism would be against our right to religious freedom.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: The religions are not more than a system that was born to contribute an order that today is defined by the political systems of each country, reason why the atheism should be adopted by the modern society<sep>Keypoint: Science can adequately explain the universe
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that the religions are not more than a system that was born to contribute an order that today is defined by the political systems of each country, reason why the atheism should be adopted by the modern society

Argument: No one belief system should be adopted or endorsed, it is entirely a personal decision that should be kept private.<sep>Keypoint: Atheism discriminates against religious people / violates freedom of religion
